createTable.remarks: A camera that the system manages

column.name: id
column.remarks: The ID that uniquely identifies the camera

column.name: created
column.remarks: The time that the camera was created

column.name: name
column.remarks: The human-readable name of the camera

column.name: address
column.remarks: The address of the ONVIF endpoint as ip:port

column.name: onvifuser
column.remarks: The user name to use when making requests to the camera

column.name: onvifpassword
column.remarks: The password to use when making requests to the camera, it's stored in clear text on the camera

column.name: profilenumber
column.remarks: The number of the onvif profile used for high-res video

column.name: lowresprofilenumber
column.remarks: The number of the onvif profile used for low-res video

column.name: lowressnapshot
column.remarks: If true then pull snapshots from the camera as jpeg rather than decoding a low-res video stream

column.name: camera_id
column.remarks: The camera the event is related to

column.name: type
column.remarks: The type of event as defined by the LightMotionEvent enum

column.name: canceling
column.remarks: true if this is the canceling event that marks the end of an event

column.name: text
column.remarks: The human-readable text the describes the event
